1: +.200

I caught these on sale for $12 and am so glad I gave this pair/brand a try. Wore them for my HIIT class today and they helped me keep confident during my workout. I hate a rolling waistband and these stayed in place the whole time. The fabric rivals that of Lululemon and were long enough (I am 5'11 and they hit at the top of my shin area). I highly recommend

2: +.354

These leggings are now my favorite workout pants. They're buttery soft, but stay in place, and move with me during my workout. They're comfortable at the waist, but stay put. They're a bit see through when stretched to the max and a bit thinner feeling than the more rigid leggings I've had from the Amazon Basics brand, but it's still much better then non-athletic leggings and much more comfortable than those rigid ones. I'd highly recommend them!

3: +.342

i am 65,5'4",170lbs and go to planet fitness 3 days a week. they go on easy(I have a natural large behind)they stay in place, soft material and def not see thru. I like that they are high waist and there is a pocket in the back to put my iPod. totally recommend!

Wow, this material is thin! I returned these for a brand that seemed like they would hold up to daily life better.

6: +.262

I am 5' 2", 215 lbs and curvy. Based on customer reviews, I ordered an XL at first but they felt too tight. I returned them and ordered the 1X. They are still snug, but in a comfortable way. I have learned that these are very 'straight up and down' and that if you are curvy, you may want to order up a size (even if it means you are putting a few extra 'X's on to the size that you usually don't)! I do recommend them. The material is strong, and so super soft. They are very well made.

16: +.239

My daughter loves the Core 10 Yoga Pants! They fit as expected, but by looking at them, you wouldn't think so! They definitely stretch and as my daughter said, she felt "put together". They are high waisted and she didn't fold them over. They aren't really made to fold over, so just know they are high waisted. The Core 10 Yoga Pants are comfortable and wash well. As you can see by the picture below, they come to her ankle, but she is only 5'2" tall. Overall, a nice fit and good look for her. I would like to see the price point in the $25-$30 range and not $35.

Overall, these leggings run small so buy them 2 sizes larger and they will look fantastic on you! :)

I own four pairs of these now. They are comfortable and comparable to my Lulu ones. As with the higher price brand, I recommend no fabric softener and hang dry when possible. This will extend the life of your leggings and avoid stretching of the fabric. These are squat proof and the higher rise helps with insecurities in my waist.

These are highwaisted and the spandex blend at the waist is very supportive, which is great for holding everything in place during a workout, but not as great, when you just wanna lounge on the couch. It's a little bit like wearing control top hose. Just be aware... these are great for athletics, not athleisure.

58: +.116

If you don't already know, the Core10 is Amazon's own clothing brand. According to their size chart, Amazon's standard size chart, a size 3xl fits 53 - 55inch hips. I am not between these sizes (a little below) but I always order a size or two up, since shopping while having wide hips/thick thighs can be challenging. These pants DO fit, however, they are very snug. If you have a butt, these will not fully cover that up as you move/bent around. The material is okay, not as luxe as some of the Nike brands (of course), but doesn't have that workout feel material. It feels more like leggings you were with a cute outfit than something you would want to wear to the gym or to workout. It reminds me of the "new quality" Old navy has now vs a couple of years ago. The color is a little lighter than photographed (I thought it was more peachy-orange) since it also has that peppered/heathered style fabric. If you order from the Core10 brand, as I've tried other pants from them in plus sizes, I would size up one and maybe even two (if you get leggings or any compression pants). I probably will not reorder until Amazon gets in new styles/fits. I also DID return these LOL. I hope this helps :)

My only complaint would be that the black isn't quite as black as I would like.

100: -.118

Then there is the size issue. These are not extra large, these are more like mediums and I knew that might be the case with the brand's sizing charts, I just want to draw your attention to it. Check the size charts before you order!

128: +.005

These days I wear two kinds of pants: jeans and yoga pants. Until now, my go-to yoga pants have been from a large manufacturer of large women's clothing. They look good and they hold me in where I need to be held in, and they look fine for office wear at work. Depending upon the style, I have paid $60-80. Enter Amazon Brand - Core 10 Women's 'Build Your Own' Yoga Bootcut Pant at $40. They fit as though they were made for me, they also hold me in where I need to be held in, they're as comfy as they can be, and they're available in something other than black. One quibble: lose the heavy ziplock bag, Amazon. It's unnecessary and we need to cut down on plastic wherever we can. Aside from that, I could not be happier with these lovely pants. Thanks!

129: +.144

I coach at the high school level almost year round. I need durable material and something that is well made because I wear this type of pant almost every single day. Being a larger and long legged woman, I have STRUGGLED to find a good pant. I prefer a thicker, slicker material with a high waist and the boot cut. (The boot cut because we have livestock and that's what I am used to wearing.... but mostly because the wider cut at the ankle helps slim and lengthen the leg.) I NEED more of these, but they are OUT of the product. Only 1 in a tall and in my size was available in any waist so I snatched it up. I LOVE it!!!!! After 10 years, I've finally find a yoga pant I LOVE! (Most were too thin, not stretchy enough, too short -didn't offer tall inseam-, etc.) THANK YOU!!

140: -.038

My only real criticism is the color, or really the lack of color options. I'd love to have a pair in grey, tan, dark brown... they're amazing as everyday or even work pants, but wearing just black all the time doesn't work. Come on amazon, give us some color choices!!

141: +.363

I've never spent this kind of money on yoga pants before, but after I read the reviews and received my item I felt the quality of the product justified the purchase. It's not easy to find fitness offerings in a 2x-3x, and it's even harder to find some many customized options (waistband type, different lengths). I really appreciate that us larger ladies are represented and that Amazon has created a product for all shapes and heights. I ordered a short, which at 5'5, fits just right. I appreciate the higher waistband option I picked, and feel like it will help me feel comfortable and covered when doing wide ranges of motion that include squatting and bending. If these pants hold up well to inner thigh rub and bi-weekly washes, I'm sure another pair will find its way into my shopping cart very soon!

184: +.248

These are the only pants I ever want to wear now. They're incredibly comfortable and flattering. The fabric is soft yet durable and very breathable. They don't get the funky sweaty smell all my other workout pants get after a long day of sweating in them. The capri length ones hit me (5'4") mid-calf, just where I like them, and the v waist is so comfortable. The only flaw I see with these pants is that when I put my phone in the back pocket, the rubber of my case sticks out and rubs against my lower back, causing really uncomfortable friction. This might not be an issue if you have a smaller phone (I have the iPhone 7) or don't use a case. It could be fixed by simply making the pocket a little deeper or by moving the pocket to the thigh, which would be ideal in my opinion for accessibility. But I won't let that small flaw effect my rating because just that they have a pocket at all is amazing. Overall, these are really great quality pants and I highly recommend them, especially if you're plus sized like me and have trouble finding quality workout gear.

The all black, simple style goes with every single workout shirt I own and will never clash with my sneakers. As a friend of mine once said as we were training for our first 5K, running clothes should be "party on the top, business on the bottom," meaning crazy shirt and solid leggings. It's a philosophy I agree with, and these capris are definitely business on the bottom. They are very comfortable. One practical addition is a small zippered key pocket on the back of the pants. They have so far washed well without any shrinking or fading.

If you think yoga pants are poorly made of thin, flimsy material, think again. These pants exude quality and craftsmanship. the fabric is lovely. It is thick but soft and stretchy. It is heavy enough to be comfortable outdoors during the brisk autumn days. These are mid rise capris. the material is moisture wicking and the double layered waist band has a small but useful pocket in the back. They are very comfortable and allow a full range of motion. But they do run small and if you prefer a less form hugging fit, go up a size (or two). They are machine washable but the care instructions are so miniscule they are not easily readable. But that being said these pants provide everything you want in a yoga pant: comfort, range of motion and style.

278: +.213

I was surprised by these! I got them in a war drive box and ended up watching for a sale to buy a second pair. They've held up well over the last 1.5 years. Very comfortable and have held up well to washing. Not see through either! I do more light athletic options, and it is great. I cannot speak to high impact workouts, but I imagine they'll be great.

285: +.248

So impressed! At first I took these out of their amazing packaging... did you hear me say that? Yes! The packaging itself is adorable and is PERFECT for gifting these, which you are going to want to do, like today! They arrive in a clear heavy duty plastic pouch with the company name imprinted on it. The one end is opened by a plastic zipper (similar to a kitchen baggie). Super cute. The Capri inside is folded nicely. At first when I took them out I was thinking they can't possibly fit, they look smaller than they fit (don't be alarmed). These particular pair have small holes built in to see through the calves (design). They come with a zippered pocket on the back. I think I was most impressed with their ability to stay pulled up in front and did not roll down my stomach. All sizes and shapes deserve workout clothes, these feel great and are made to move with you and not end up rolled down your stomach 10 minutes in to bending over! They are tight fitting, very comfortable and they hold shape. I wish I could find a negative aspect but I just can't. They are perfect!

286: +.108

Core 10 Women's Build Your Own Run Tights - Medium Waist Capri, Light Weight, Black, X-Large. This mid rise capri features lightweight 4-way stretch fabric, perforated panel on calf. It is high-waisted, made with lightweight, moisture-wicking fabric, perforated calf insets for breathability. Core 10's exclusive fabric has an opaque look with a silky, lightweight feel; an internal drawcord waist, with reflective accent at hem and a back zipper pocket that features two compartments . 19" inseam. It is also 100% satisfaction guaranteed. Have just worn these through a tough workout, and later, a dance lesson. They did fine. Not too hot, wicking and perforation worked. The design of the leggings is unobtrusive while being worn. A useful item for an active lifestyle. Recommended.

I've been wearing for about 3-4 months now and they are still in excellent condition. Plus size recommended. I would give the bras a 3-4 just for that. Styles are cute cause face it we wanna work out cute and confident at any size. I really don't think you will be disappointed in the leggings. I don't care because I wear my tops about 2 to 3 inches longer than that. If you plan to wear these with a short top, you'll want to think about it. 825: +.078

They're extremely simple--no drawstring, no pockets--and very thin as far as "sweat pants" go, but what do you want for $10 bucks? I usually wear around a size 24. I'm so glad that they come in petite! I tried a 4X-petite because I'm a shortie (5'1" here!) and they're comfortably large on me. I will likely order another pair and I'm considering ordering a 3X-petite instead. They are not so big that they are falling down, but I do step on the heels just a little bit because I really am just that short and the waist has enough room that I may be able to reduce a size. I was hoping they'd shrink a bit in the wash but they don't have appeared to after their first washing, but they got washed in cold water this time. I may intentionally wash them in hot next time and then I'll decide on the next size that I'll order. I bought them strictly for pajama pants/lounge pants for around the house and they're great for that. I wouldn't wear these in public. The legs are very wide and they're baggy and probably don't look flattering on me, but thankfully the crotch does not hang too low so they're comfortable. They're sufficient for house pants. Update: I washed them in hot water and they shrunk just a little bit and now fit me perfectly. I'll probably buy more. I just really wish they had pockets!

For washing, I turn them inside out, wash them on warm, and there's been no shrinkage. I do notice fleece in the dryer's lint catchment receptacle after a dryer cycle, but that's not at all of concern to me, and does not affect the shape or wearability. I'm so singly happy with this purchase and the quality, I ordered another pair yesterday. Incredible product. Incredible value. Please don't change anything. I'll be back for more pairs for sure.

830: -.064

Two things I wish I had realized before I purchased these sweatpants, 1) There is no band around the bottom of the leg. I'm 5'3 and there is at least three inches of fabric under my feet. I have to tight roll them every time I wear them. I'm proud to report my tight rolling skills are still on point, but I don't want to feel like it's 1985 and I'm on the way to the Breakfast Club premiere every time I want to exercise; 2) there are no pockets... I carry my phone with me while I walk to track my mileage and in case of emergencies.... the sight of an overweight 44 year old woman huffing it down the road is not enhanced with a fanny pack strapped to said personage... but now it has to happen. It's cheaper to buy a fanny pack then replace all the pants I've purchased. I probably could have figured all that out if I had read more carefully, I was just too excited to find sweatpants in my size that didn't cost $45 a piece, to be in a right mind about it. They fit as expected and the fabric is nice and thick. I think they'll last a while.

831: -.001

I have quite the internal struggle about these sweatpants. On the one hand, they are extremely soft and comfortable, and the fleece is nice and warm. On the other, that same warm fleece pills up like crazy! Imagine the disappointment of pulling your sweatpants off and finding fuzzies all over your legs and thighs, and then needing to clean yourself off to get rid of said fuzzies (larger ladies like myself will hopefully relate - thighs rub together!). The fuzzies migrate down the pant legs too, so I find them on my socks, in my shoes, or on the floor. Both pairs I bought do this, in spite of washing them a few times. So sadly they'll be relegated to pajama bottoms for cold nights, instead of exercise pants as I'd hoped.

832: +.147

I had no idea these would be so soft! I think I'm in love. They aren't fleece exactly, but the insides are fleecy and feel amazing. I bought these to use as pajamas so I dont really care what they look like, but they don't look half-bad either! The material is thin and is therefore more flattering than my old bulky ones. Yet, somehow these sweatpants manage to be MUCH warmer than any I've owned before. I'm really happy I made this purchase. For the price, I just might buy several more pairs! Note: I am 5'4" and the petites ARE an inch or two too long. This always happens with me and sweatpants because I like them really loose and deliberately buy a size or two larger than I need. I thought it was worth mentioning, though, since the length seems to be a concern for some of the other reviewers. You might want to order petites even if you are average height and you might want to get a more snug size if you don't want the extra length. YMMV.

For a change, I can really relax. My only complaint is they are about an inch or two too long, so drag on the floor despite deliberately trying to shrink them with hot washes and overdrying on the hottest dryer setting. I can deal with it and just wear shoes with a thicker sole when out of the house. At this price, when the hem eventually gets raggedy, I'll either just cut it off or order yet another pair.

1215: +.021

Bought numerous pairs of these sweatpants while living in a nursing home after having hip reconstruction surgery. I needed something comfortable, soft and cost affective for physical therapy every day. These did the job well. I would recommend washing them once or even twice before wearing. The inside of the pants are super soft but there is a lot of lint inside that will end up on your skin if you don't wash them first. Normally this wouldn't have been a problem because I always wash new clothes before wearing, but being in the nursing home made that difficult. I wore them and took them off right after some intense physical therapy and my legs etc were covered in lint. All drawback to these pants, but not worth downgrading them to 4 stars. Only other thing is that I wish they had pockets.

1643: +.111

I got this to wear to a group yoga class, and I am VERY happy with it. It stayed put, is flattering, and is of pretty decently-good quality. If I could change anything, I'd just add the extra cotton layer that women's things often have at the crotch. The waist goes up high enough to compress some of the belly pooch, which was definitely what I was needing. No muffin top with these! I like the bit of white on the side - it causes the eyes to think the leg is skinnier. I read the reviews here, and bought my size based on them, and I am very happy with the size I got. I usually wear size 18 pants (maybe size 20), and a size 1x shirt. I bought a size 3x of these leggings, and it was the perfect size for yoga! (If I were running in them, I would have wanted a 2x.)

1647: +.452

I like these pants but was a little surprised at the waist. The fit of the actual pants is fine, but the band of elastic at the waist cinched in more than I'd expect given the size I ordered. It was distracting enough when sitting on an exercise bike that I had to take a quick break to hit the locker room and physically stretch the band out a bit! It loosened just enough so I wasn't distracted or pinched anymore, but also convinced me that the pants were better sewn/made than I'd expect given the price - the stitching and fabric were unaffected by my warping of the one tight strap of elastic inside. Overall, I'm very pleased!

1648: +.157

Good fit over my oddly-shaped body. I have a short inseam so these were down to my ankles but they were perfectly comfortable with me hiking them up to my knees. Covered my butt and belly just great and didn't roll down during exercise. Fabric was cool and light. I am a 24/26 in bottoms and got the 4X.

1649: +.092

These had a good rating so thought I would try them. I am a size 18W normal clothes, so ordered a 1x. The fit was perfect. I do not understand why others are saying they do not run true to size, as they do. The capris were the nice matte stretchy cotton, not the shiny type I hate. The material was a little thin for my liking, but did not seem see thru. I did not like the waist band. It looked like someone stitched the top down and then inserted an elastic band. It was very flimsy and had NO compression on the belly so was not happy. When I bend over, the top kind of rolls down. I was going to return them, but decided to keep them to use for hanging around the house pants. They really are nice looking and the price was only $13, so the comfort made me keep them. Not good for working out though if you need the compression waist band to hold the gut it. I would not buy these again, but gave them a 4 star rating because they are cheap, cute and comfortable.

1650: +.199

I actually really love the material. My thighs run together so leggings typically do not last long for me as the friction begins to tear them apart. These aren't extremely cotton and have a nice stretchy feel. The quality is great for the price. They are kinda big. I may have over estimated my own size so I can't hold it against the leggings. But they aren't too big. I still wear them to the gym and they fit my legs and butt just fine. I love the little white on the sides and I'm a big fan of the cropped leggings look. Will probably purchase another pair in a bit smaller size. But so far they are a really nice quality pair of leggings.

1651: +.117

I could've kept & worn them, but I was afraid they'd stretch out too much. I suggest that you order the size that you usually wear.

1935: +.117

Amazon Prime, arrived in 2 days. Just pulled from package and the stitches skipped on the front sleeve hole (picture 1.) No other stitching issues. Lightweight material, not as soft as expected. SNUG FIT for a 3X. Pictures 2 & 3 are of the JMS black 3X tank and for comparison a Croft & Barrow 3X (purchased at Kohl's.) Quite a difference. The current size chart is off by one size - UNLESS you want a snug top. As I purchased this to wear under a sheer black top I'll keep it (but will be on the look out for a softer shirt due to skin sensitivities.) Just keep in mind you may want to go up a size. Hope this review helped.

1936: +.061

I was pretty excited to come across two of these tank tops. They were advertised as having a shirt tail and I like that style. The shirt tail is quite small almost cut straight across. I am a middle-aged woman with a woman's figure so I was pretty careful to check out the size and the measurements on the size chart. Boy was I disappointed when I got these tops. They are cut skimpy and the fabric is quite thin. Not at all what I expected. I don't know about the rest of you ladies, but I am so weary of these companies cheaping out on the fabric. I stay the same size but have to order bigger clothes to get a proper fit. These shirts are cut for young women.

1937: +.161

I normally wear a size xl, 2x if I want something to be loose and comfy. Because of other feedback stating these run small, I ordered the size 3x. They fit like I would expect a 2x to fit, very loose.. I bought three of them to wear when I work out in the yard. They are very lightweight and comfortable. I hope they do shrink a bit when I wash them because they are very roomy, but if not, no harm. For the price, well worth the purchase. I'm 5'8" and the length is as pictured. They cover the behind and front and look fine with leggings. I really like the shirt tale bottom, too. UPDATE: I have now washed these and they do shrink a bit. The 3X now fits much better. However, I since ordered 2 more of these at the 'add on item" price. Watch your cart. They were $3.85 when I put them in the cart but when I checked out, they had apparently increased the price, as I was charged $4.99 for each one. Still a good price for a cheap shirt to work outside in, but so irritating.. This happens a lot on Amazon. The constant price changes are frustrating.

1939: +.043

This is a simple, cheap longer-length tank good for around the house and exercising. I bought it first in briny pink (a really pretty, flattering color for us olive-skinned gals). I have it in 4 other colors now. This is nothing earth-shaking. You put it on, do your workout or just lounge around with it on warm days (cool as it's cotton and sleeveless). I wouldn't overdry this. Also, look at the size chart CAREFULLY and then probably still size up. I normally wear 18W or 20W (unless it's a runs-smaller designer brand). I usually wear 2x. But in this, I'm 3x. I don't like my tank tops for workouts really snug, I like some looseness. On the chart, I'm at the top of the 2x range, so I hopped up: glad I did. If you like it snug, go by the chart precisely. Don't expect a super quality workout shirt experience here. This is basic. NO frills. But for me, six to 10 bucks for a shirt I'm gonna just laze around or sweat in is a-okay. :D Now, if they only would bring a nice true red and a royal blue. That would be nice.

1942: +.099

1944: +.124

I happily recommend this as a layering piece. I wanted something to wear under semi-sheer blouses and this has a scooped neckline that covers bra straps well, as do the shoulders. I did not want anything snug, so after reading the reviews I ordered one size up (2X to 3X) and it fit perfectly around my bust and hips. The fabric is about what you would expect for men's undershirts that come three in a pack; it is actually heavier than I expected for a tank in this price range. At 5'5", it ends at the same location on my body as the model, so it tucks in nicely but won't ride up and come untucked. I would not consider it not long enough to wear with leggings. I docked it one star because, even though I might wear this fabric and fit as a top (in black, at least), the armholes are quite large and there is no way to hide a bra under there. I do find it suitable for wearing under an open sweater

1946: +.143

Love these tanks, but please know, these are NOT for fashion. This is just a nice, basic lounging/layering tank in 100% cotton. Couple of things: everyone that has mentioned the underarms poking out at the sides, yeah... they were right. Order about 1 size up if you want a truly loose fit (I'm normally a size 12 or 14, and I bought 3X due to other reviews- glad I listened). These are long enough to cover your behind even if you're tall (I'm 5'9" and that was a nice surprise). Also know that if you order this tank in a light color or white, you'll be able to see the printed-on label through the fabric on the back. Again, not for fashion. I bought these to wear under some rompers and cute overalls, and for that, they're perfect. I don't know that I'd wear them on their own, as they look a little very casual after washing and wearing. I'd definitely order more of these for sleeping, too.

1947: -.206

1949: +.131

Size: 2X. Color: Pale Pink. Has a printed-on "tag" on the back neckline, printed vertically with 7 lines of info in black ink, so on paler color tops it does show through a little on the outside. back neckline. "Made in Honduras". Has a sewn-in cloth care tag on inside lower left seam: "100% cotton. Machine wash cold with like colors, inside out if decorated. Use only non-chlorine bleach when needed. Tumble dry low, cool iron if needed. Do not iron decoration." Fit: Much too big around the armholes, scoop neck is a little too low for my liking. Isn't marked "Pre-Shrunk Cotton" so I'm hoping it will shrink up a little. 2X is my usual size, but the shirt-tail hem was kind of snug around hips and rear end. Quality: Very well-made; no loose threads or crooked seams. Fabric is light-weight and not completely opaque. You can see through it a little when held up to light, and when you have it on you can see where your bra begins and ends. But I got it to layer under summer blouses (also not completely opaque), so it will work for my purposes. Not entirely happy with the fit so probably won't buy this style again, although in general I've been happy with other Just My Size products.

1956: +.267

Good basic tank top for warmer weather. Looking at the reviews, I sized up to a 2x, a larger size than I usually wear. For reference, I'm 5'4" and 160lbs. I usually take an XL top. This shirt was initially too large but shrunk down nicely in the wash. It's still a bit roomy at the bust, but I have the t shirt version of JMS in a 1X and it's too tight for my liking, if that makes sense. I'm a middle aged lady who likes loose fitting tops. I love the roomy cut at the hem, just right. The material isn't super thick, but you can't read the paper through it either! For the price, I can't complain. 1957: +.178

To start, I have other Just My Size t-shirts already. I am also of medium height and about double the size doctors want ladies to be. To address the size labelling, in JMS I order a 5x and hope, in other brands I have ordered through Amazon I buy 2x to 6x when it is available. Please note, some 6x clothes would fit a Barbie Doll so those I avoid. READ THE COMPANY SIZE CHARTS! They are usually close. As to this tank, I have the black 5x. It is a lovely fit from top to bottom! It is loose enough to not pull anywhere and not baggy. The fabric is a very nice mid weight t-shirt knit, not sheer at all but also will not too heavy to wear, even when it warms up. I hope they bring in summer bright colors in this top! This shirt would layer quite well with either a turtle neck under it or a comfortable blouse over it or them both in cool seasons as well as a sheer or gauzy jacket style blouse when it is not too cool out. I plan to make this top and the other copies I just ordered into real workhorses in my wardrobe!

1961: +.121

I purchased two of these tops last year, one in May and one in December, to use as sleep shirts. The material in both is a weighty cotton with the one purchased in May being a bit heavier. Unfortunately, after repeated washing following the label directions, the side seams on both tops are somewhat twisted so that the shirttail hem openings on the sides are not actually on the side - one is slightly toward the front and one toward the back. This is fine for sleeping but I would never be able to wear this out of the house if I so desired. The material itself has held up well after repeated washings; side seams, not so much. They are comfortable to wear, though.

1970: +.136

2956: +.053

Colors true and vibrant--out of the package. Fabric lightweight and comfortable. The neckline is more V shaped than the picture shows, which is a plus, in my book. The sleeves are long (well past my fingertips, but I'm short), but they shove up nicely. I ordered a size larger than I normally wear, due to reviews, and the fit is perfect. They tend to run a bit tight through the hips, I think, so if you are a bit larger, consider going up a size. I love these shirts, BUT some colors fade badly--I ordered dark pink (Sizzling Pink) and a light pink (Pink Swish). After one washing, the light pink lost half its color, and it has continued to fade more with each wash. Too bad, because they are perfect otherwise. But then I only paid $8, so I guess I got what I paid for.

2957: +.323

I usually buy this brand one size bigger account for shrinkage. I also like to wear my shirts long. These shirts were no exception. Luckily, they come in a great variety of sizes. They wear and wash well. Glad I found them on Amazon--very convenient.

2959: +.140

Just My Size clothes used to be sized correctly or generously. I bought a big size to wear this as a huge comfy hang around top. This top is tiny, smaller than small. Selling it as a 3X is a huge scam plus I have to pay return shipping. There is this influx of chinese made clothing, even the biggest brands are selling it. The clothes are SMALL, very small. This is not just this shirt. Many of the listings actually say "Chinese sizing" as a warning. This one did not so I am out for the return shipping cost. Had it said chinese made, I would not have bought it.

2960: +.020

2961: +.100

WARNING! Make sure you know that these tops run VERY small! I always wear an XL to a 1X. These were skin tight and fit like mediums. They're thin and don't have a lot of stretch either. I like them for the price so re-ordered 2 sizes up. Hoping the next ones fit and aren't too big now. UPDATE: Just received the 3 t-shirts in 2 sizes bigger than I normally take. They are still a little tight. They fit more like a tight 1x. Sizing is definitely not as it appears. They do not hang like in the pictures. If you like skin-tight t-shirts, then these are for you. 2964: +.182

I have modest to normal sized breasts so, no problem there with the fit. I wanted some colorful tees to wear layered under sweaters for winter, under other tops for fall and spring, alone for evenings in summer and these are PERFECT for those purposes! Because of the snug fit, the work GREAT under other tops for layering. Even tops that are marked as the same size as these. The colors are bright and coordinate with most of my clothes. The fabric is soft and hasn't shrunk with warm water wash and a hot dryer, no fading yet either. Price can't be beat too.

The material is thin so I wear a vest over them and that works perfectly. I'd recommend this product for low cost and quality.

Definitely size up. I am size 18 but like a loose fit through stomach and hot dryer for my tees so sized up to 4x. Perfect fit. Has five and movement but with feminine cut so flattering and it like I'm wearing a mans tee. I don't like the finish of the fabric however. It picks up every piece of hair and lint. 2968: +.213

If you are a 1X and not busty, you may be able to get away with a 2X, but better to have the room and allow for shrinkage. In the 3X it's pretty long for my 5' frame, so I may have to hem it. Still it's a great value at this price and worth simple hemming. Or for sleeping, or wearing around the house, you could just cut it and leave it raw.

3563: -.132

I have been wearing this style #(8118) for years because I have very sensitive skin and allergies to some man-made fabrics. These had to be cheap knock-offs. The fit was okay around my body and the cup size was good, However, when I pulled up the straps (that are one size and do not have adjustments), the whole bra pulled upward so far in the back the band was in the middle of my shoulder blades and my breast fell out from under the front band. I measured these bras #8118 with a new one (style #8118, I purchased from another place at double the price) and sure enough, the straps were 4 inches shorter. So, these bras are no bargain. Do not buy !!!

I bought the light pink color and I don't find the material thin at all. It's a nice weight and definitely thicker than some of the other tees I have tried. 3616: +.268

Recommend. These pants are really good. They feel and look like cotton with some stretch. However, there is no semblance of a tummy control panel. The big thing for me though, is that they FIT. I am 5'2 and have managed to develop quite some hips, gut, and buttocks. I bought the XL, 29 inch inseam, and they fit perfectly. As I said, no tummy control at all... So I am reordering today, and might go down a size. It would be great if these came in more colors!

4077: +.062

I have purchased these leggings MULTIPLE times. I am a bigger girl. I hate jeans. I can't find jeans that fit. I hate the feel of them. IT'S SIMPLE. I hate jeans and love leggings. That being said, leggings are a big girls NIGHTMARE. Most leggings are see through, rip easy, and look gross WAY TOO FAST. Call me gross, but I pretty much wear these 6 days a week. They're easy to wash. I throw them in the dryer (although they might last even longer if I didn't). These are my daily "jeans". I probably replace them every 6 months. For every day use, I would say that is WORTH IT. Yes, they have a nike swish, but it's 2019, and you can dress anything up or down. You can NOT see through these leggings, they stay on, they're durable, they hug me without suffocating me, and they have a wonderful flat black look. I weigh about 260 at 5"10. I currently order a XXL and that seams to be the right size for me. I gave these 4/5 stars because I do think the upper band should be wider to avoid folding around the tummy when sitting/bending. Hope this review was helpful!

4088: +.182

You know what happens... you're searching for something in particular that you can't find in local stores, so you go onto amazon and see exactly what you've been looking for. Then you order it, eagerly away its arrival, try it on, and it's horrible... the fit, the quality, whatever. Not only that, but it's either impossible to return or simply not worth the effort because you "think" you'll be able to lose 10 pounds and eventually fit into the XL item when you normally wear a Medium. Well, FINALLY, that did NOT happen! And it's a glorious experience. I used the size guide they have on their images of these pants and ordered... then waited and hoped... and I wasn't disappointed. I'm 5'5" @ 165-pounds and ordered the XL (I'm normally a size 10) and they fit perfectly. Not so tight that they show every cellulite dimple, with a high-rise waist that slims out the tummy pooch. They're as comfortable as yoga pants and the material looks nice enough to wear to work. I ordered the gray and they look like nicely fitted slacks. I haven't trimmed them yet because I like to wear heals and the length isn't too much of an issue, but will probably take off about an inch so they don't drag. I love that they make it easy to hem. So, in short, I'm order more colors. These are awesome... especially on those "bloated" days we always seem to have. ;p

I put them on and then thought yep my stomach will be killing me soon and I will have to take them off because tight clothes and I don't mix. NOPE! I could where these all day! They're also a surprisingly thick material that I could only describe as what I think a wet suit might feel like. Lol I don't really know what they feel like but these are super smooth and much thicker than any other pants I've tried. They do a pretty good job at smoothing out the not-so-flattering areas on my backside too! I really do love these pants and it was worth the price!

4114: +.036

The material is a thick spandex-type of material and NOT see-thru...PERFECT! The four pockets are a nice plus. 4115: -.063

I really liked when I tried them on, the feel great and can definitely be worn to work in a casual environment and would be great for travel. HOWEVER, they are way too long. I followed the instructions for cutting the Hem EXACTLY and with a nice pair of fabric shears. The Hem is jaggedy, looks totally unprofessional, and cannot be worn except in the house. Also, with no guide around the inside for cutting the front and back come out uneven, again with really nice fabric shears. Therefore, these get a one scoring. They are not with $30+ dollars because they would need to be hemmed professionally for another $30 (I live in an expensive city). This company should produce in multiple lenghs. It's work around ruins them and will cost you $$$.

4116: +.134

I have a very casual work environment and can wear yoga pants to work. However, I like to have them look a tad more dressed, so I've been on an active hunt for yoga pants with pockets. I was thrilled when I found these and have them in the black, gray and blue! I am 5'7" tall and around 185 pounds. I ordered the large in all 3 sizes as I like my pants to be fitting on my thighs and bootcut from the knee down. I read the description which very clearly states that these pants are not hemmed (to all the reviewers out there who left negative reviews for this, the seller does clearly state they are not hemmed), but I was okay with that due to needing the length (I have a short torso and long waist). I did take all 3 pairs to my tailor as I wanted a more finished look and had her hem them all. Even with the cost of hemming, totally worth it! I love the silkier feel of the pants, I personally think it dresses them up, and no one at work knew they were yoga pants (even though you can see the outline of the front pocket, you can on some dress pants too and it legitimizes them more as dress pants in my opinion). If you're hesitating, I say order a pair and check them out.

4121: +.186

I bought all three sets around the same time frame. Lets just say the target pants are faded, Ripped in several places, the inner thigh worn out. THESE pants, Almost like the day i bought them. Still black as ever, no holes only wear and tear are around the feet as they tend to come large which is fine with me. Honestly these will go another year no problem in my eyes. Its hard to find pants these days that can go several years of good use and not have to toss them.

4626: +.176

I was really impressed with the quality of these pants. The fabric is very smooth and non-transparent. It has actual functional pockets. The back pockets are on the small side, but could accommodate a small set of keys or small billfold. The front pockets are a bit larger and easily accommodate my phablet sized phone. I think you could do yoga or run with a phone in your pocket if you needed to (the phone outline will be visible through the pants). Shortening the inseam was very easy. I quilt, so I just used my rotary cutter, ruler and cutting mat. I recommend taking it slow with the shortening and trying it on in between cuts. I would say the pants run just on the small side of "true to size." I think you will not regret purchasing these. I'm already considering purchasing in another color.

4627: +.052

I love these pants! I have bought 3 pair now, in different colors. I am a law student and have to dress professional when at school. I love wearing these pants on days when I can wear business casual instead of a full suit. It is noticeable, especially with the seam on the back, that they are not slacks, but if you have a long enough shirt, you can get away with having them look like slacks. The pockets are an especially nice feature. They are stretchy, with a wide waistband which is not too tight on the waist, while still being slimming. I noticed after buying my 3 pairs, that the length is different between them. Even between the 2 black pairs. One fit me perfectly with length, and the other was way too long (I am 5'7"). Fortunately these pants have a nifty little feature that allows you to cut to your own length - all you need is a pair of scissors, and to line up the horizontal stitches near the hem (see photo - they are much darker in person than in my terrible photo). My strengths do not include cutting in straight lines, so even though the cut I made was really not the best, I was happy to see that you really can't tell once you are wearing them. Great pants, buy a pair!

4628: +.264

I love them! I'm 5'8" with a 33" inseam. I struggle to find pants that fit properly - either too short or too long. These give me the option to just cut them to the length I want without having to hem them. I cut them between the reinforced marks and put a couple quick tack stitches in the seams just to be safe. The pockets are great, and better than expected. I followed the size chart and they fit great - not too tight. I have the straight leg ones, too, and love them both. They're sporty, but also business appropriate. A sharp pair of scissors are all that is really necessary to cut them. If you happen to have quilting notions, a rotary cutter & ruler work beautifully!

5072: +.147

Bought these in my usual size and they are perfect. Supportive but not too tight. The fabric is kinda silky, so even after a few washes so far it isn't crunchy or itchy. Passes the "bend over" test and doesn't show skin through the mesh (any male friend will gladly help you with this inspection). Have worn roller blading, yard work, jogging, water play. My favorite part is the pockets. As a jogger I always had to wear an arm band to carry my phone so I could listen to music, which made accessing my phone cumbersome. The pockets hold my 8+ snugly so it doesn't bang around or slip out, but it's easy to pull out when I need access. These don't shrink or pil in the laundry. I'm buying more.

5073: +.134

These by far are the best fitting yoga/ workout leggings I have ever purchased. I'm 5'11 and have always struggled finding leggings that fit well and are comfy. I get compliments every time I'm wearing them. If I could get away with wearing them every day I would!!! I ordered a second pair in the gray same size but they didnt fit the same as the black pair I bought. I was frustrated and sent them back and re-ordered a second pair same size different color but again didnt fit like the black ones. They were too small. I contacted the seller and seriously the BEST customer service I have ever experienced from a seller on Amazon. They quickly apologized and made it right by sending another pair. I have never had a seller ve so quick to solve an issue and be so kind about it. Definitly going to keep buying from them.

5074: +.350

I found these athletic capris to be very well made and perfect for exercising (power walking and strength training) and sports (volleyball and yoga). The fabric is soft, flexible, well-tailored, and rich in color. I bought the purple, grey, and blue pairs in an XL (I usually wear L, so you'll want to size up). I also bought the long workout style in black. They perform as well and look just as good as their expensive brand-name counterparts. And you can't beat the price! The shipping was fast and my first return (exchange the large for XL) was seamless.

5075: +.192

I LOVE these workout pants. You can't see through them at all which is amazing, and the pocket on the side is so convenient. They're also incredibly adorable, it's nice to have a pair of black capris that have a little extra detail on the side. My one and only complaint would be that while they fit really well, the waist band does not fit tightly. It's a little on the loose side so if you're wanting to hide a little extra chub like me it doesn't doesn't suck you in like other pants I have. Maybe I just got too big of a size but I ordered my usual size in workout gear. Still would highly recommend them though!

5076: +.234

First off, I adore the color of this. It looks great against my skin, a sort of light brown, mocha-ish sort of tone. The fit is even better than I expected. It feels snug, but in no way confining. I would assume this works great for anyone but would be very flattering for those who are more toned all around as it hugs onto your body and highlights your curves gently. The pockets are, thankfully, big enough to actually hold my phone, so they are easily one of my favorite pair of leggings now. The end of the leggings stretch comfortably past my ankles and don't feel tight anywhere.

5077: +.077

I ordered a size up because the last pair I bought ran small. These run a little big. There is also no compression or shaping. If you're looking to lift things a bit, these are probably not for you. They are well made, not see through and have pockets on both sides, which I love. Definitely ordering a smaller size.

5078: +.131

I was not a fan of these. I am 5'10" and 200lbs and I got a size XL. The material is not very stretchy, it grips hard on your body, and because of that it shows imperfections instead of hiding them, as yoga pants should. I will be returning these. What I did like about them is the style on the sides of the legs and the pocket size. If you're looking for a nice quality pair of yoga pants on amazon, try the Bestena tummy control ones. They're great. I will be leaving a review on those as well for more details.

I was not a fan of these. I am 5'10" and 200lbs and I got a size XL. The material is not very stretchy, it grips hard on your body, and because of that it shows imperfections instead of hiding them, as yoga pants should. I will be returning these. What I did like about them is the style on the sides of the legs and the pocket size. If you're looking for a nice quality pair of yoga pants on amazon, try the Bestena tummy control ones. They're great. I will be leaving a review on those as well for more details.

5080: +.123

I spent a very long time on Amazon searching for the "unicorn" of workout/day-wear leggings for my very specific needs: black, capri, lightweight, side phone pocket, high-waisted pants with mesh sections. And when I say high-waisted, I mean I want HIGH-WAISTED. I'm 9 months postpartum and all of these leggings that claim to be high-waisted really aren't-- they come to my belly button or barely above it. Anyone who has a postpartum belly like I do knows that belly button height won't cut it-- there's a whole other pooch above it that needs held in. These do the trick. I live in the desert, so the capri and mesh sections make a big difference. I was thrilled to feel how lightweight these leggings are. I got excited before I even opened the package because it was so light. They feel smooth and almost velvety. AND they have a pocket for my phone. Now, I plan to use these leggings for every day "Mom" wear and walks around the neighborhood, so I can't tell you if they are "squat proof" or if they hold their own after multiple workouts, but they seem like they'll be easy enough to wipe clean after my baby spits up on me for the millionth time in a day, so I'm happy. I'm 5'2 and 175 pounds, with an hourglass shaped "mom-bod" that's a work in progress, and the XXL fits beautifully.

5081: +.369

I am 5" 6" and weigh 285lbs. (Down from 315! Woot!) Pros: Really beautiful with great detail and vibrant color High waist band Thick fabric, not see through Good amount of compression Cons: Underwear line is visible Thin line of elastic rolls during squats

5082: -.023

So.... I know what size I wear. I know how to read a size chart. I know how to measure to figure out which size I should wear according to the chart. I ordered the size that a) I know I wear, which was b) the size the chart said I should order according to both the chart AND my measurements AND the size I usually wear. These were *at least* TWO SIZES SMALLER than the chart indicated they should be. Not. Even. Close. They're already on their way back. They did seem to be well made, other than the sizing. Note that the mesh insert IS see through, but is lined down to about bike short length so it's probably not too revealing for those of us who don't like to reveal too much.

5083: +.208

Its all good, but the best thing about them is how they fit above the waist. No more sliding down because their to short from crotch to belly button. Those days are gone when I'm in my UURun!! I wear them around the house n yard because they hold me in which helps prevent fatigue. The side pockets are deep to keep my phone with me without it popping out. Absolutely love them!! Don't change a thing!!

These are perfect for spring and summer. I'm 5'9, about 220 - 225 (more pear-shaped) and ordered the XXL.... fit like a glove!

5101: +.096

I bought an XL based on other reviewers & the bra part fit perfectly. I'm 5'4", ~185 pounds. Normally wear a 38DD-DDD. The 'over shirt', while pretty loose in the chest area, is not loose in the middle area. It just fits. So if you've got a little middle, it'll be loose, like the picture. But if you carry any of your weight in your middle area, while not 'skin tight', it's definitely not going to be 'loose fitting' like on the models. Overall, I like them (I ordered the 2- pack). They're encouraging me to trim up a bit in my middle section lol. Sports bra is typical material. The over shirt I'm not sure, polyester of some kind I think. It's thin, but I'm not wearing these for a fashion show. For around the house or light exercise, they're great.
